words.fact: Discovery is the foundation of great product management. It involves understanding customer problems, conducting user research, validating assumptions, and identifying opportunities. PMs spend time interviewing users, analyzing data, and exploring the problem space before building solutions.

Planning transforms insights into actionable roadmaps. This includes prioritizing features, defining success metrics, creating user stories, estimating effort, and aligning stakeholders. PMs use frameworks like MoSCoW, RICE, and value vs effort matrices to make strategic decisions.

Development is where ideas become reality. PMs collaborate with engineering and design teams, run sprint ceremonies, clarify requirements, unblock issues, and ensure quality. They balance technical constraints with user needs while maintaining momentum toward shipping valuable features.
